text:
1. Eastern extremity of 24th Street, at Avenue A.

April 27, 1930.
P.L. Sperr

2. Pier No. 72 East River; prior to 1917 a recreation pier. Occupied since by the United States Government as a base. Note the repair ship "Wheeling" stationed here.

May 23, 1936.
P.L.Sperr

1. Eastern extremity of 24th Street, at Avenue A.

April 27, 1930.
P.L. Sperr

2. Pier No. 72 East River; prior to 1917 a recreation pier. Occupied since by the United States Government as a base. Note the repair ship "Wheeling" stationed here.

May 23, 1936.
P.L.Sperr

Exterior (Marginal) Street, north from East 23rd to 24th Streets. At the left is the Municipal Bath House that fronts on Avenue A. The fenced-in gravel pit at it's rear will be removed and a swimming pool constructed here. The J. J. Little & Ives Co. bookbinding plant is on 24th Street. To the right are the institutional Bellevue Hospital buildings. The General Construction Corp. yards between 24th and 25th Streets will be cleared during the constructional period of the East River Drive (1940-1).

May 23, 1936

P. L. Sperr

East 24th Street, north side, west across Avenue A. Prominently shown is the plant of the J. J. Little & Ives Co. This backs up to the Municipal Lodging House on 25th Street. The photographers vantage point is the small childrens play area that is being built at this point as a portion of the new East River Drive. The Municipal Bath House is to his left and is not included. In the background is the vague outline of the new block square annex to the Metropolitan Life Insurance Co. Bldg.

July 18, 1939.
P. L. Sperr
